ABOUT.TITLE: In alternation, computer engineer specialized in virtual and augmented reality
ABOUT.DESC:
Hello, I'm Adrien Syrotnik, I'm 22 years old and I'm in my fifth year of studies in computer engineering at CESI in Reims. My professional goal is to become an engineer specializing in the field of 3D and virtual reality.

During my studies, I have acquired skills by working on projects using Unity and Unreal Engine engines. I also have knowledge in software development (C++, C#), Web 2.0 (HTML, CSS, Angular), Web 3.0 (Solidity, Web3.js), network and artificial intelligence.

I possess essential skills to be an engineer, such as problem-solving, analysis, and critical thinking. I am capable of understanding clients' needs, designing technical solutions, and working effectively in a team or autonomously.

I'm currently doing a work-study program at Bertrandt in Paris. If you are interested in my profile, do not hesitate to contact me via the contact section. You can also check out my CV in PDF format via this link and my portfolio accessible via this link.

À l'aide des commandes intégrés au jeu (: Using the game's built-in commands (datapack and command blocks), and with the help of a friend, we made various mini-games in the Minecraft video game. You can find our creations on our lientr.ee.
Réaliser des mini-jeux dans le jeu vidéo: Make mini-games in the video game Minecraft
Inspiré du célèbre jeu Super Smash Bros,:
Inspired by the famous game Super Smash Bros, we made a similar game with our favorite video game characters.

With Link from The Legend of Zelda series, Doomfist from the game Overwatch, Edward Kenway from the Assassin's Creed saga, or the character from our video game Emergency Exit, we created a total of 10 playable characters with unique abilities!

You can see a demonstration in the attached video.
Pour ce projet, nous avions pour but de:
For this project, we aimed to copy exactly the game Mario Kart.

We finally managed to reproduce this game in Minecraft by constructing the circuits, reproducing the karts, and the object system.

Being quite limited, we used pigs as karts, for example.

You can see an example of the game via the attached video.
Cette fois-ci, ce jeu n'est certainement:
This game is certainly not known to everyone.SheepWars was a game mode I discovered on an old Minecraft server. We missed this game, and to test our abilities, we decided to reproduce this old mini-game.

The goal is quite simple: 2 teams compete on a field in which we can get sheep that we can throw and have certain powers.

For example, we have the Incendiary Sheep, which is shown in the images on the right, which, after some time, explodes and spreads fire around it. The final goal: to eliminate the entire opposing team!
Réalisé en processing (langage dérivé du: Realized in processing (language derived from java), I realized with a friend (Arthur Joris), a small game from A to Z. This one had to be presented at our BAC because it represented our final note in ISN (Computer Science and Digital Science).
Emergency Exit est le nom que nous avons:
Emergency Exit is the name we gave to this game. The goal is very simple: to escape.

We wanted to make this game from scratch, so we had to make the gameplay, the images, and the physics of the game itself in Processing, a language specialized in graphics.

After several months, we had finally finished our very first video game under the band name "Aidia Info".

This one lasts about 15min, so if the urge strikes you, you can play our game by downloading it from this link (Windows only).
Après avoir terminé le jeu, nous voulion:
After finishing the game, we wanted to go further and decided to burn our game on a CD.

So we made 2 CDs, allowing us to keep our game in physical format.
Hébergé sur github, ce premier cv marque: This first resume, hosted on Github, marks my beginning in the web world. You can go take a look using this link: https://adrien-syrotnik.github.io/CV-Syrotnik-V1/.
Étant en plein stage concernant Angular,: Being in the middle of an internship concerning Angular, I wanted to change my website and at the same time progress on this framework. So I decided to do it under Angular, although it doesn't reflect the whole framework. A better design, a dark mode, and different translations were my main goals for this project.
Un de mes principaux objectifs est de tr: One of my main goals is to work in the field of video games, so I started to make a game where you have to throw stones. Although the game is not too advanced, I have the ambition to make a game later on.
Début d'un jeu sur Unity: Start of a game on Unity
Un test sur le moteur Unity: A test on the Unity engine
Étant très intéressé par le domaine du j:
Being very interested in the field of video games, I was interested in the different game engines that exist on the market.

UnrealEngine, CryEngine, Unity, so it's on this last one that I've focused to make a little test game.

The initial idea was that monsters appear in a kind of cave and that our character has to throw projectiles to stop them.

The following video is a demo of what I imagined with what seems to be a goblin and stones as projectiles.
Création d'une application de gestion de:
Created a custom appointment management application on the Laravel framework. The goal of the application was to be able to search for the different appointments as well as the referrals and sponsors linked to them.

The name of the software comes from the person who asked me for this custom software. Different statistics were available and allowed for additional features that other software, such as Google Calendar, does not offer.
Création d'une API web via nodeJS. Une p: Creation of a web API via nodeJS. The first version was made in Laravel, but it did not succeed. This one should allow to make online purchases and manage the stocks of a small sales corner integrated into our school and managed by the students (snacks, drinks).
API pour mon école et ses étudiants (Nod: API for my school and its students (NodeJS, Express)
Le but de cette application était de cré: The purpose of this application was to easily create animations. I wanted to animate small ideas easily without any hassle, but I didn't know of any software that could do that, so I decided to create my own.
Créé avec le langage <u>Processing</u>,:
Created with the Processing language, a derivative of Java, the principle is as follows: to be able to create points that can be linked together, then to be able to change their positions in time. Finally, you just have to launch the playback and it's done!

As you can see, I created this little animation opposite, using the software.

If you want to try it, download it here (Windows only).
Souhaitant me mettre au défi, j'ai souha: I wanted to challenge myself, so I decided to make my own minesweeper, an iconic game.
Programmé en <u>Processing</u>, un dériv:
Programmed in Processing, a derivative of Java, I managed to make a 100% functional minesweeper. You can note where the bombs are with right-clicks, and there is also an "anti-bad luck" system to avoid running into a bomb on the first hit.

You can see a preview with the image on the right, but if you want to test my minesweeper, you can download it here (Windows only).

On top of that, I made some scripts to time yourself when you want to do a speedrun.
Souhaitant réaliser un speedrun sur le j: Wanting to realize a speed run on the game Emergency Exit, and given that the speedrun.com website is very limited, I decided to build a website that will allow realizing speed runs on this game.
Reproduction du site speedrun.com et réa: Reproduction of the speedrun.com website and creation of speedrun scripts
Un site web : un backend et un frontend: A website: a backend and a frontend
Pour réaliser ce projet, il fallait pouv:
To realize this project, we needed to be able to store the information in a database, so we had to build a backend in addition to the frontend. I decided to build the backend using the Express.js framework and the frontend using Angular.js.

The frontend was also done in collaboration with Arthur Joris, the same person who developed Emergency Exit with me.

You can find the website via the link below: cv.adrien-syrotnik.fr/speedrun
Une des problématiques que j'ai rencontr:
One of the problems I encountered when building this project was being able to make a precise chronometer.

I decided to make a script that allows making a precise chronometer.

The method consisted of retrieving the addresses of the pointers used by the application, and using them in a script that allowed them to be interpreted, to finally start and stop the timer.

I also made a video on this subject: https://youtu.be/TrgG9KnDgK8
Projet réalisé au sein de mon école, l'o: Project realized within my school, the objective of this one was to realize an application allowing to save a file in another one in a totally protected way. During this one, the notions of design pattern, socket, and process were deepened.
Stage au cours duquel j'ai repris entièr: Internship during which I took over all the coding done by the previous interns. My mission was to finalize the programming of an internal software for the company, allowing the team members to manage the progress of a project. The application was realized in PHP and Javascript.
Stage au cours duquel j'ai pu apprendre: Internship during which I learned how to use the Angular javascript framework and how to set up a continuous integration system. My goal was to create a front-end web application that would display content from an API.
Réalisation d'un tutoriel sur Unity me p: Realization of a tutorial on Unity that allows me to create a tank game locally.
Créé à l'aide du logiciel Unity, <i>Tank:
Created using Unity, Tanks! is a multiplayer game where 2 players play on the same machine.

This game was created using a tutorial on Unity Learn.

You can download it here (Windows only).
Réalisation d'un mini-jeu basé sur le ba: Realization of a mini-game based on basketball.
Créé à l'aide du logiciel Unity, <i>Bask:
Created using Unity, Baskettooo is a mini-game where the player must try to score the most baskets in a given time to get the most points.

This game was created in the context of my lessons on Unity Learn.

You can play the game via this link.
Souhaitant réaliser un jeu en ligne, ce: Wishing to create an online game, this game had as objective to test my recent skills in Unity. In addition to that, I learned how to create an online game using Netcode and Unity Services.
<i>One Shot</i> est un mini-jeu multijou:
One Shot is a multiplayer mini-game where the player must survive against his opponents. To eliminate the other players, the player has a stick that can shoot lasers that can kill in one shot, and he can run, jump and slide.

To realize this game, I had to understand and use the Netcode plugin of Unity that allows to create multiplayer games. To try my game online, I also used the "Unity Services" that allowed me to connect to other players everywhere (Relay).

You can download the game via this link (/!\ The game will not work because I need to activate the relay on the Unity services).
Application en AR (Réalité Augmenté) réa: AR application (Augmented Reality) created in the context of my internship and a research work in the Technical University of Cluj Napoca. The goal of this application is to allow visitors of a museum to visualize 3D objects in the real world on a bronze mold that is 2000 years old.
Visualisation de modèles 3D à l'aide de: Visualization of 3D models using augmented reality (Unity / Vuforia)
Cette application a été conçue dans le c:
This application was designed as part of a research work entitled: "Enhancement of cultural heritage with extended reality: The case study of the Dacian matrix with hollow designs".

The objective of this article was to see how extended reality (XR), i.e. virtual reality and augmented reality, could be used to improve the experience of visitors of a museum. To do this, an augmented reality application was created, allowing visitors to visualize 3D objects on a bronze mold that is 2000 years old.

Animals were engraved on the mold and the application allows to highlight the 3D models of each animal. If the user clicks on it, a description and an animation appear. The user has the possibility to rotate the 3D models or to change the materials that compose them. Finally, a history part is available, allowing the user to observe with photos, how the object was found.

This application was created using Unity and Vuforia.
Jeu VR basé sur le jeu Blade and Sorcery: VR game based on the game Blade and Sorcery, which was to be created to finalize the VR path present on the Unity learn website. The goal of the game is to use weapons and spells to kill opponents who appear in the form of a wave.
Jeu VR de simulation de combat (Unity /: VR game of combat simulation (Unity / XR Toolkit)
Tech and Sorcery est un jeu VR développé:
Tech and Sorcery is a VR game developed on Unity based on the basics of the game Blade and Sorcery.

The goal of the game is the following: use weapons and spells to kill your enemies. You can find here a video presenting the whole project.

Different skills were necessary to carry out this project. Overall, during this project, I learned to: create shaders, create VFX effects, code an AI, do motion recognition, use XR Toolkit to make interactions with the player in VR ...

If you have a Meta Quest 2 headset, you can download the game via this link.
Lorsque vous arrivez dans le jeu, votre:
When you arrive in the game, your right hand allows you to draw shapes. Ceraines shapes are linked to symbols (Fire, Earth ...) and drawing them one after the other allows you to trigger combos and therefore to launch a spell.

There is a total of 7 symbols and 8 combos currently in the game. There is for example the fireball spell. To launch it, just draw a fire symbol followed by a whirlwind symbol. This will launch a fireball in front of the player that will do damage to the enemies hit.

You can find all the spells by watching the video, or the images present here.
Que serait un Tech and Sorcery sans ses:
What would a Tech and Sorcery be without its technologies? That's where the weapons come in!

There are 3 weapons in the game: a laser pistol, a bazooka and ... a laser sword!

The laser pistol is a basic weapon, it allows you to launch lasers that do little damage to enemies but with a high rate of fire.
The bazooka allows you to make explosions at a distance, inflicting a lot of damage.
Finally, the laser sword not only inflicts heavy damage on opponents, but also cuts some elements of the decor!

You can find all the weapons by watching the video, or the images present here.
Application en VR (Réalité Virtuelle) ré: VR application (Virtual Reality) made during my internship at the Technical University of Cluj Napoca for a museum. The purpose of this one is to allow visitors of the museum to be immersed in a virtual world and to discover ancient pottery, by manipulating them and scanning them to learn more about these ancient artifacts.
Application de réalité virtuelle dédiée: VR application dedicated to a museum allowing the discovery of 3D models of ancient pottery (Unity)
La réalité virtuelle pour améliorer l'ex: Virtual reality to improve cultural exploration
Commandée par un musée, cette applicatio:
Ordered by a museum, this application allows visitors to discover ancient pottery by manipulating them and reading descriptions in the user's environment.

To obtain the 3D models, different scans were made on real pottery, then imported into the environment. The decor, on the other hand, was created from scratch on the Blender software.

Various features have been added to the application, such as the ability to scan the pots to obtain their description, to change the language of the application, to listen to a narrator or the ability to break the pots with enough force. You can discover all the features by watching the video above.
Reprise du célèbre mod <u>Lucky Block</u:
Taking over the famous mod Lucky Block, we decided to recreate it in Minecraft.

The goal is simple: break lucky blocks that can give you items, monsters or traps.

You can see an example of the game via the attached video.
Machine à sous en ligne avec thèmes géné: Online slot machine with themes generated by an AI (Svelte / Python)
Conception d'une machine à sous en ligne: Design of an online slot machine, integrating themes generated by artificial intelligence, allowing users to customize their gaming experience. The project also includes animations to increase realism, with a 500% return for an entertaining gaming experience, accompanied by a random bonus offering between 3 and 9 wild symbols.
Casino AI, ou \"Dynamic Slot\", est une:
Casino AI, or "Dynamic Slot", is an online slot machine made with the Svelte framework.

The main objective of this project was to create an online slot machine integrating images generated by an artificial intelligence. The ultimate goal was to allow the user to customize the machine on which he wants to play, even if it does not exist yet.

To achieve this goal, I used several artificial intelligences, including OpenDalleV1.1, which is hosted locally on my machine. This artificial intelligence is used to generate images of the machine based on a theme chosen by the user.
Subsequently, to optimize the results, the OpenAI API was used. GPT-4 was used to generate texts related to the theme chosen by the user, and these texts were then used as descriptions for the generation of images with DALL-E 3.

You can try the slot machine directly on this page or by following this link.
Afin d'apporter un réalisme accru à la m:
In order to bring increased realism to the slot machine, I integrated animations.

When the user starts the machine, the reels start moving, stopping one by one. The winnings of each round are displayed, and the credits are updated. In case of big winnings, a specific animation is also triggered.

As for the return for the player, it is set at 500% (5€ for every 1€ bet). My goal was mainly to offer an entertaining gaming experience rather than a realistic one.

Finally, a bonus is available randomly (with a probability of 5%). This bonus allows you to get between 3 and 9 wilds (wild symbols) on the machine.
Conception d'un site web permettant de j: Design of a website allowing to play a geography game. The goal is to find the exact location of the player on a map of a video game. The website is made using the Svelte framework, and the games tested are: Counter-Strike 2 and Zelda Minish Cap.
Basé sur le principe du jeu <a href=\"ht:
Based on the principle of the game GeoGuessr, and taken from the idea of the website LostGamer, the goal of this game is to find the exact location of the player on a map of a video game.

To do this, I used the Svelte framework to create the website, and used the libraries Leaflet and Three.js for the mapping and 3D (360° view) part.

The games tested are Counter-Strike 2 and Zelda Minish Cap, to test both 3D and 2D games, which differs from the LostGamer website which only offers 3D games.

In order to create panoramic 360° images of CS2, I took several screenshots of the game, then I assembled them to obtain a panoramic image (stitching) using the openCV library on Python.
Faisant suite à mon premier <a href=\"/p:
Following my first website made in HTML/CSS, I decided to redo it in Angular.

My goal was to create a more modern website, with a better design, a dark mode and translations in several languages.

In addition to that, I hosted my website on a personal server, more precisely on a Raspberry Pi 4. This allowed me to improve on the server side and to use Docker Compose.

Thanks to this server, I was also able to host other services like Traefik, my speedrun website or my online casino.
Conception d'une application mobile perm: Design of a mobile application to find outdoor sports fields. The application allows to find sports fields nearby, or via a search, and to see the information on these fields (equipment, schedules...) using geolocation and data from the French government API.
Application mobile de recherche de terra: Mobile application for finding sports fields (React Native)
Sport Dehors est une application mobile:
Sport Dehors is a mobile application made in React Native.

The goal of this application is to allow users to find outdoor sports fields. Currently in a trial version, a POC, the application currently only allows to search for city-stades and street workout fields in France.

To do this, the application uses the user's geolocation to offer him fields nearby.

The data of the fields are retrieved via the French government API, and allow to see the information on these fields (equipment, schedules...).

The application is available on Android and iOS thanks to React Native which allows to create multi-platform applications with a single source code.

Finally, this project was an opportunity to work in a team (3 people) and to work on project management.

You can see some images of the application here.
